items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  6.01
	 
	 
	 
	 
The following agencies/organizations have donated items for the second year to help support our McKinney-Vento students and their families:
	 
Family Giving Tree:  Celeste Dearmore and Doug Harney
Family Giving Tree has donated 50 fully stocked backpacks for our students.  They also provided Christmas gifts and toiletries, and continue to provide our students with personal hygiene products, diapers and wipes, toilet paper and cleaning supplies.
Hilton Hotels:  Lisi Bettencourt, Director of Housekeeping
Hilton has donated comforters, pillows, and linens as well as toiletries, for the second year in a row.
Kohl’s Department Store:  Sheri Manii, Assistant Store Manager
Sheri and the Associates in Action team provided registration and distribution support at our Annual Holiday Celebration.  In addition, Kohl’s donated $500 which will be used to provide additional to families in need.
Touch a Life Foundation:  Tej Gundavelli, Founder
Touch a Life has donated 50 backpacks, 50 packages of socks and also provided us with over 50 hooded sweatshirts.
Wal-Mart Neighborhood Market – Evergreen Village:  Priscilla Sanchez, Laurrencka Jones and Dyanna Banderas
For the second year, a total of 60 families received Christmas dinner boxes consisting of either a turkey or ham, a bag of potatoes, stuffing mix, cans of vegetables, dinner rolls or breadsticks, and a pie or cookies.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  8.02
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
FROM:  
					 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, André Bell, Assistant Director of Capital Accounting and Purchasing, and Duggan Kerney, President, CPRS
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Presentation, Discussion and/or Action to receive the Fixed Assets and Inventory Report
	 
	 
The District contracted with California Property Record Systems (CPRS) to conduct an inventory of all district fixed assets.  In this case, fixed assets include all furniture and equipment valued over $500.00 at time of purchase (including taxes and shipping costs).  This is required by our liability and property insurance carrier and for compliance with the State Education Code. 
	 
Attached is a copy of the results of the audit, including recommendations for further implementation by Administration.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive the fixed asset inventory report.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item: 8.03
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, Linda da Silva, Director of Construction, Maintenance and Facilities, and Rogelio M. Ruiz, Esq., Legal Counsel
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Approve Final Proposition 39 Facilities Use Agreement with ACE Charter High School
	 
	 
On November 1, 2014, the District received a request for reasonably equivalent facilities for the 2015-2016 school year from ACE Charter High School.  (“ACE”).  Pursuant to the Charter Act and Title 5 of the California Code of regulations, section 11969.9, the District timely responded to ACE’s request for facilities and ADA projections. 
	 
The District and ACE thereafter entered into collaborative discussions regarding a facilities use agreement for ACE at Independence High School but subject to approval by the Board.  A copy of the proposed one year agreement for facilities at Independence High School is attached for Board consideration.
	 
If the Board approves the form of agreement as presented, Administration requests authority to submit to ACE a final one year facilities agreement substantially in the form presented.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
General Fund, Measures G, E and/or I; Capital Facilities Funds
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
To be determined
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the form of Memorandum of Understanding Re: Prop. 39 Facilities Use Agreement 2015-2016 between the District and ACE for a one year term and authorize Administration to enter into such agreement in substantially the form presented.

items.item_details:
Members of the public may address the Board on any subject not on tonight’s agenda; however, provisions of the Brown Act (Government Code Section 54954.2(a) and 54954.3) preclude any action.  As an unagendized item, no response is required from the Board or District staff and no action can be taken; however, the Board may instruct the Superintendent to agendize the item for a future meeting.
	 
Any person may address the Board on any item on the meeting agenda.  Persons wishing to address the Board must fill out a gold request form, which is located at the entrance of the Board Room. When your name is called, please come to the podium, state your name for the record, and limit your remarks to three (3) minutes.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  11.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Van T. Le, Board President
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Appoint Two Board Members to Serve on a Committee to Review 2015 Citizens Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) Applications
	 
	 
As part of the process for the appointment of members to the Citizens Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC), the Bylaws require the Board to appoint two Board Members to serve on a committee to review applications received.  CBOC will select one of its members in good standing to serve on the application review committee.  The appointed Board Members and the selected CBOC Committee member shall make recommendations to the Board regarding the appointment of candidates to CBOC.
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board appoint two Board Members to serve on a committee to review the 2015 Citizens Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) applications.

TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cari Vaeth, Associate Superintendent of Human Resources
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Approve Compensation to Staff Not Represented by a Bargaining Unit
	 
	 
The District is recommending that Certificated Administrators, Classified Managers and Confidential employees be granted a salary increase for the 2014-2015 school year consistent with bargaining unit salary considerations granted. The 5% salary increase, plus any equivalent 2014-2015 increase given, consistent with bargaining unit salary considerations granted will be effective retroactive to July 1, 2014.  
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
General Fund
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
As per Salary Schedules
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the compensation to staff not represented by a bargaining unit. The 5% salary increase, plus any equivalent 2014-2015 increase given, consistent with bargaining unit salary considerations granted will be effective retroactive to July 1, 2014.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  11.04
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Van T. Le, Board President
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Approve 5% Base Salary Increase to Superintendent Chris D. Funk; Associate Superintendents Marcus Battle, Juan Cruz and Cari Vaeth; and Senior Manager of Internal Controls Kelly Kwong Consistent with Bargaining Unit Salary Considerations Granted
	 
The District recently settled contract negotiations with ESTA, CSEA and AFT bargaining units, which resulted in a 5% on-schedule increase to the members of each of those bargaining units, retroactive to July 1, 2014.  
	 
In a previous agenda item, the Board is asked to consider and approve a 5% increase to management and staff not represented by a bargaining unit, also retroactive to July 1, 2014, i.e., consistent with the agreements reached with ESTA,CSEA and AFT.
	 
The contracts between the District and each of the Superintendent, the Associate Superintendent and the Senior Manager of Internal Controls provide that each of those person’s base salary “shall be increased prospectively by the same percentage salary increase that may be granted by the Board of Trustees” to the District’s certificated management or management personnel in any given school year.  (Emphasis added.)  Since the applicable agreements provide for only prospective application of base salary increases, the Board is asked to consider and approve the 5% increase in base salary to each of the Superintendent Chris D. Funk, Associate Superintendent Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent Juan Cruz, Associate Superintendent Cari Vaeth and Senior Manager of Internal Controls Kelly Kwong, plus any equivalent 2014-2015 increase given to the Certificated Management, effective July 1, 2014.  
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
As per the Superintendent, Associate Superintendent's  and Senior Manager of Internal Controls Contracts
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Various
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the 5% increase in base salary to each of the Superintendent Chris D. Funk, Associate Superintendent Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent Juan Cruz, Associate Superintendent Cari Vaeth and Senior Manager of Internal Controls Kelly Kwong, plus any equivalent 2014-2015 increase given to the Certificated Management, effective July 1, 2014.

SUBJECT:
Presentation and Discussion regarding Instructional Coaching Initiative
		 
The Instructional Coaching Initiative was launched this year as an investment in our educators with the goal of supporting the talents and aspirations of our teachers.  Research demonstrates that effective coaching encourages collaborative, reflective practice and allows teacher to apply their knowledge and skills more deeply, frequently and consistently then working in isolation.  Nine coaches are active in this important work with teachers across our District.

FROM:

PREPARED BY:

SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Approve Distribution of "Go For It" Scholarship Funds.
		 
Administration is requesting approval to award $19,500.00 for the "Go For It" Scholarship Fund to East Side Union High School Students.
		 
Silicon Valley Community Foundation requires authorization to release and distribute funds upon receiving required documentation from  recipients.
		 
The District in the early 1990's, invested an initial $500,000.00 in revenues into the "Go For It" fund and collected several hundred thousand dollars from the private sector to create annual interest revenues to fund scholarships.
		 
The investment fund had not performed well during the economic downturn, but recently it has recovered and the District can resume awarding scholarships.  We recommend issuing 26 scholarships worth $750.00 each totaling $19,500.00.
		 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$19,500.00

Silicon Valley Community Foundation

It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the distribution of the "Go For It" Scholarship Funds

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:13.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Karen Poon, Director of Finance
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Receive and Approve Second Interim Financial Report for Fiscal Year 2014/15
	 
	 
This is the second of two (2) Interim Reports to be presented to the Governing Board for the 2014-15 fiscal year.  The report provides the Board with the financial status of the District as of January 31, 2015.  This Report is presented to the Board to provide the current fiscal status of the District and to meet the fiscal accountability requirements of AB 1200.  
	 
Included is an executive summary which summarizes the financial data from the SACS Reporting System and budget assumptions that provide the basis for determining the District’s fiscal status.  In addition, there are supporting documentation and comparative analysis of the 2014-15 First Interim vs. Second Interim updates as of January 31, 2015, multi-year projections, State reporting forms, and other related documents.  These documents and worksheets serve as tools to certify the ongoing fiscal health of the District for this current year, as well as the two (2) subsequent fiscal years.  
	 
California school district revenues and expenditures are subject to constant change.  School district budgets are not static documents but, instead, are constantly revised to respond to decisions and actions at the State, local, and Federal levels.  The Second Interim financial projections have been updated to reflect new information received and Board actions taken since the Budget was adopted.  
	 
California Education Code Section 42131 requires that the Governing Board of each school district certify in writing within 45 days after the close of the period being reported whether or not the school district is able to meet its financial obligations for the remainder of the fiscal year and subsequent two fiscal years.  The certification is classified as either positive, qualified, or negative.   
	 
Based on the District's Second Interim Report and multi-year projections as of January 31, 2015, I am recommending that the Board approve the attached positive certification for the East Side Union High School District.  Your approval will provide certification to the State ensuring that the District is able to meet its financial obligations for the current fiscal year and subsequent two (2) fiscal years.
 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive and approve the Second Interim Financial Report revisions to the operating budget as presented for fiscal year 2014/15.
